intro: Phanera porphyrotricha, commonly known as the purple-stemmed phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive purple stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia. Phanera porphyrotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
